content.text:
# List of Cultural Properties of Japan – historical materials (Saga)

This list is of the Cultural Properties of Japan designated in the category of  for the Prefecture of Saga.
National Cultural Properties
As of 1 January 2015, one Important Cultural Property has been designated, being of national significance.

Prefectural Cultural Properties
As of 1 January 2015, twelve properties have been designated at a prefectural level.

| align="center"|Illustrated Industries of Hizen ProvinceHizen-koku sanbutsu zukō ||  || Saga || Saga Prefectural Museum || the eight scrolls show local industries including fishing, catching whales, hunting, horse-pasturing, pottery, coal mining, and paper-making ||  ||  || [http://www.pref.saga.lg.jp/web/kankou/bunkazai/zai_top/kensaku_top/data_ken_rekishi01.html#jyu147 ]

| align="center"|Pair of Mortarsmoruchīru-hō ||  || Saga || (kept at the Saga Prefectural Museum) || the 1843 mortar was imported from Holland, the other produced in Japan || ||  || [http://www.pref.saga.lg.jp/web/kankou/bunkazai/zai_top/kensaku_top/data_ken_rekishi01.html#moruchiru ]
|-
| align="center"|Autograph Letter of Toyotomi HideyoshiToyotomi Hideyoshi jihitsu shojō ||  || Karatsu || Saga Prefectural Nagoya Castle Museum || to his wife One (Kita-no-Mandokoro) on the twenty-second day of the fifth month of Bunroku 2 ||  ||  || [http://www.pref.saga.lg.jp/web/kankou/bunkazai/zai_top/kensaku_top/data_ken_rekishi01.html#hideyoshi ]
|-
